summary: This is an email chain from August 9, 2019, between an FBI NY CART Coordinator and another recipient, providing a status update on the processing of electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein. It details the number and types of devices (iPads, iPhones, iMacs, hard drives) that were imaged, processed, or found to be encrypted/locked, noting that nothing had been reviewed pending a taint review.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The electronic items being processed by the FBI CART team were seized from him, as indicated by the subject line 'Epstein CART items'.

events.title: FBI CART Status Update on Epstein Devices
events.description: An FBI NY CART Coordinator provides a status report via email on the processing of electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein, detailing what has been imaged, processed, or found to be encrypted.

keyFacts: As of August 9, 2019, the FBI had seized and was processing a significant number of electronic devices from Jeffrey Epstein, including 3 iPads, 1 iPhone, multiple iMacs, external hard drives, and loose media.
Several devices presented technical challenges: one iMac was locked and could not be imaged, and one external hard drive was imaged but encrypted.
No review of the device contents had been conducted at that time, pending a 'taint review' to address potential legal or procedural issues.
The communication indicates an active and ongoing forensic examination of Epstein's digital evidence following his arrest.
